page.title: 10ATHERSTONE BALL GAME
page.content: The origin of the game is not known,but it seems to have started as a local rivalry between "Warwickshire lads and Leicestershire lads".A popular legend of the Middle Ages hints that it dated back to King John.This mediaeval ball- game on Shrove-Tuesday still survives today,although frowned upon by police and traders because of occasional damage and disorder.It differs from any other game of football,for there is no level pitch,goalposts,Â£off side ',or referee.Play takes place in the main streets and participants are encouraged to act in sportsmanlike manner,often the ball is Â£smuggled' too early.At the start of the game the ball has many coloured ribbons attached which when handed in at the end of the game(the team holding the ball,at 4.30pm)and exchanged for money.Winning team then visits pubs to raise money for charity
